1.0.1.Author: "Winston Chang" [aut, cre]
1.0.1.Description: The R6 package allows the creation of classes with reference<U+000a>semantics, similar to R's built-in reference classes. Compared to reference<U+000a>classes, R6 classes are simpler and lighter-weight, and they are not built<U+000a>on S4 classes so they do not require the methods package. These classes<U+000a>allow public and private members, and they support inheritance.
1.0.1.Title: Classes with reference semantics

2.0.Author: "Winston Chang" [aut, cre]
2.0.Description: The R6 package allows the creation of classes with reference<U+000a>semantics, similar to R's built-in reference classes. Compared to reference<U+000a>classes, R6 classes are simpler and lighter-weight, and they are not built<U+000a>on S4 classes so they do not require the methods package. These classes<U+000a>allow public and private members, and they support inheritance, even when<U+000a>the classes are defined in different packages.
2.0.Title: Classes with reference semantics

2.2.0.Author: Winston Chang [aut, cre]
2.2.0.Description:
The R6 package allows the creation of classes with reference
semantics, similar to R's built-in reference classes. Compared to reference
classes, R6 classes are simpler and lighter-weight, and they are not built
on S4 classes so they do not require the methods package. These classes
allow public and private members, and they support inheritance, even when
the classes are defined in different packages.
2.2.0.Title: Classes with Reference Semantics

2.3.0.Author: Winston Chang [aut, cre]
2.3.0.Description:
Creates classes with reference semantics, similar to R's built-in
reference classes. Compared to reference classes, R6 classes are simpler
and lighter-weight, and they are not built on S4 classes so they do not
require the methods package. These classes allow public and private
members, and they support inheritance, even when the classes are defined in
different packages.
2.3.0.Title: Classes with Reference Semantics
